website_summaries.verdict: Perfect choice for the business person on the move. Provides a versatile alternative to the average backpack.
pros: The versatile design features hidden back straps so it can transition from a wheeled bag to a traditional, wearable backpack
cons: When worn, tends to look boxy and cumbersome

website_summaries.verdict: High-quality design that features plenty of compartments for a high level of organization. Accommodates laptops up to 17 inches. A favorite among students and commuters.
pros: Laptop can be hidden and zipped away in a top compartment
Wheel and base cover protect clothing when it’s being carried
Wheel treads accommodate sidewalks and uneven ground
cons: Design flaw where handle pocket could let rain or snow leak into the bag in inclement weather
Inconvenient location of some compartments makes certain items hard to reach

customer_reviews.title: Get something else...
customer_reviews.text: Bag is good until it breaks and you have to deal with crappy support that do not want to help. Wheel stopped spinning after about half a year and they say that it's not covered under the 5 year warranty, stating that it is a wear and tear problem not covered. Really? By the way if you decide to use it for work forget about it, cuz according to their warranty these are only for recreational use. What a ripoff. Pics show the 'normal' wear and tear of their product only after less that a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Tess

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag and can fit a lot in it ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag and can fit a lot in it but the only down side is that where the handle comes out of the bag has a design flaw that is terrible if it rains. I fill this bag so much that I can't usually carry all that weigh on my back. If your ever caught rolling this bag through the rain all your books are guaranteed to get destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: frogangel

customer_reviews.title: Top handle ripped within a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: I have used the backpack for less than 2 months (only couple of days per week) and the top handle is now ripped. Very disappointing considering the backpack was not cheap. With the top handle hanging on by a few threads, this diminishes the usability of the bag for me. (I was using it to carry various things my husband needed during chemo treatments.)
customer_reviews.author: Kittylover

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately, poor quality, the wheel fell completely off
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bag but unfortunately the wheel fell off. I'm really disappointed to have paid this much money for such poor quality. If was not heavily used or loaded, just regular use. I'm no longer confident in High Sierra products as i used to be. The last one I bought lasted forever and never lost a wheel. Quality control has gone completely out the door, so so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Gal

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!! Top strap came undone in less than 1 1/2 months!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. At first I thought this looked pretty heavy duty, unfortunately I was wrong. I bought this for my 5th grader, in less than 1 1/2 months the top strap on top has ripped from the bag (see my posted pic). I can understand this happening to a old backpack but not a 1 1/2 months old bag. This bag is being used by my 11 year old!!! He'w not carrying anything that's intensely heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Jade The Husky

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is in high school because she has a ridicukous amount of stuff to carry between classes. I saw several reviews that complained of broken wheels but her pack has held up just fine. She's had it for weeks and it definitely takes some abuse going up and down stairs. But no breaks. Plenty of room for books, laptop & other things a teenager feels they need to carry with them. The handle extends smoothly and all zippers work just fine. We are both totally satisfied with this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Excellet Product
customer_reviews.text: It is *BIG* and holds a *LOT* but it is still agile enough to use daily as a briefcase. I often have need to stay places when I work. With this I don't need anything else. One note. I do suggest you get one of the accompanying offered products for small stuff like cables, and maybe small med bottles or pens etc There is a ton of room, but a small organizer in addition is just the thing. Just to keep the smaller stuff together and easier to find in side this "cavern" of a lappie backpack. Don't hesitate on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Speaker to Animals

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. It's roomy, it's well made, it rolls very nicely, and it looks good too. I have no doubt that it will last for years to come. I love the kick plate and the zippered storage for the straps. Those are very nice bonuses.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Product Description does not match delivere product
customer_reviews.text: The product description here states that the laptop compartment fits most 17" laptops. The tag on the backpack that was delivered says that the laptop compartment fits most 15" laptops. My 17" laptop did NOT fit in the compartment .. it stuck up about 2 inches over the top of the bag. Imagine that. I give it 2 stars because it does appear to be well constructed and sturdy. It just isn't what I was led to believe that I was ordering. Am returning now, and will look elsewhere for my rolling backpack needs.
customer_reviews.author: JodiW

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great except for the handle
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this item 1 and half star I would. I am so disappointed with this bag. I am a nursing student and this bag was highly recommended to be used. I've only been using the bag now for 3 weeks. The handle about to break due to the fact that pins no longer align anymore with the pins that hold it in place, also one of the pins is also broken and, the handle itself is having a hard time sliding up and down. This bag is going back
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: A Saving Grace!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, yet quite lovely; handles very smoothly, with plenty of storage space in every nook and cranny. I use it for my business to transport computer and accessories, along with binders, books, etc. from home to office. Plan on emptying it and use for weekend trip to Reno. Really a life saver at my age to be able to manage carrying "stuff" in a safe and easier way. Already suggested it to another person who also purchased one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Fine

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed. This item was not marked used or refurbished
customer_reviews.text: This purchase came in used with some persons name on it in 2 visible locations. it had paper pieces and crumbs in the bottom of the 1st zipper I open. The tires had dirt and tar stuck to them. I was so grossed out I closed it and didn't look through anymore and sending back. the amazon call center was hard to understand English. very disappointed. This item was not marked used or refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Dave and Mika

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pack my 17" would fit in (barely!) and had wheels - for a long flight & even longer conference This worked perfectly for all my needs - It worked great on the flight (a slightly snug fit for my laptop, but wasn't too bad through security) - could fill it with whatever I needed for the long conference days and saved my back by not having to tote it around
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy E.

customer_reviews.title: But it's not super durable. We had one earlier
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent bag. It's big, and works ok. But it's not super durable. We had one earlier, and one of the wheels got stuck. On the second one we have, the handle sometimes gets stuck when pulling up (so it only goes halfway up, and we have to fidget with it to go all the way).
customer_reviews.author: I. M. Aval

customer_reviews.title: Powerless Powerglide
customer_reviews.text: This bag is significantly heavier than any other wheeled book bag that I have seen. It did not glide easily - certainly not enough to be marketed as "powerglide" - and was just way too bulky for a child to use. I am not sure what type of weight lifting children others have that purchased (and kept) this for their young, but it did not meet our needs at all. Thanks to Amazon for their amazing return policy! I would not recommend this bag for anyone young. It's heavy, bulky, and just not well suited for standard school use.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Holabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great large and heavy duty conversion backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 17" laptop and all of my law books. Has a heavy frame but is sturdy and intended to manage an even heavier load. Conversion from roller to backpack is easy but watch out for dirt transfer when changing between wheels and backpack. The handle does get sticky when scoping sometimes and rarely zips back down - but it is incredibly utilitarian. Doesn't fit in smaller plan overheads or under seats, but fine in most larger planes. Overall, VERY happy with the product and durability!
customer_reviews.author: Chillp

customer_reviews.title: Great for college students.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter who is in college. She had back surgery and cannot carry a regular back pack. Se loves it. It has plenty of room for her laptop and books. The only thing I would change is making it water proof of even more resistant. Water from the rain kicks back from the weels. I also wish the weeks were a bit more rugged. But I’m hoping they won’t break or wear our qickly.
customer_reviews.author: Shala G

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy and well worth the price. I did a LOT of research before buying them.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these backpacks 2 years ago for a grandson and he used it for all of 4th and 5th grade. The only problem is that for the last few months of school the handle would no longer telescope so he carried it on his back. In the meantime, his brother went thru 2 cheaper packs. For the start of 6th grade I decided they each needed a new backpack that would be sturdy enough for the extra heavy book load we were told they would have. These packs have lots of compartments and they are very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Marni

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and uncomfortable. Good storage though.
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag hoping it can help me navigate through crowded cities easily during my trip. However the bag itself was too heavy for this purpose. With only one day worth of necessities (my very small computer, headset, airplane pillow, a few cloth and some hygiene products) my shoulder would feel very sore and uncomfortable after just a couple of hours of carrying it on my back. Had to find a luggage storage service in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Elica

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver - Convenient and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I would purchase this bag again, but there is no need.... it is durable and versatile. I have used it for 2 years as a backpack @ school, as an overnight bag, as a carry-on bag at the airport, and it is still going strong. After 2 years of everyday use, it is just starting to show its age around the handle (the material one, not the retractable handle - I am sure I can easily repair it - just needs to have the stitches tightened) Love this bag, it saves my aching back daily!!! Great buy for the price. Very roomy.
customer_reviews.author: Khana

customer_reviews.title: This seemed a well built backpack but the wheel fail often.
customer_reviews.text: These are well build backpacks, and work well for my kids. I cannot give these a 5 star as after half a year of usage. one of them got a broken wheel. This was the replacement, hopefully it will hold up. Update: Now on my 3rd backpack and once again the wheels fail. The wheels (plastic) are breaking off the metal attachment. It's getting frustrating. I guess that is why it's affordable as you need to replace it 2-3x a year. Having to downgrade the stars to 2 due to this.
customer_reviews.author: cloves

customer_reviews.title: GREAT backpack for college students
customer_reviews.text: This backpack saved my daughter's back and shoulders. She was carrying around a heavy backpack and a heavy laptop bag every day. She is able to fit EVERYTHING she needs, including the laptop, in this bag and roll it around campus. There is even room to spare! She doesn't have to visit the chiropractor and massage therapist as much, now that her back and shoulders aren't carrying around so much weight. It's also very water resistance and she hasn't had any issues rolling it around in the rain. Her laptop and books stay dry. Highly recommend this product and you won't regret purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime L Missimer

customer_reviews.title: so DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE! I LOVED the capacity of this backpack and how smoothly the wheels rolled, but yesterday: the top fabric strap ripped! I live in a walk-up apartment, so I need to carry this bag down a couple floors (fully loaded with textbooks and stuff I need for the day) before rolling it to my car. well, the fabric handle on top RIPPED. and the backpack straps are very thin, uncomfortable & not ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Funxsized

customer_reviews.title: Beware: not weatherproof. The handle pulls out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware: not weatherproof. The handle pulls out of an enclosure to "protect" it. However, the enclosure isn't closed at all, it connects directly to the interior of the bag. When it rains, water will flow directly into the main compartment of the bag if you are pulling it along.
customer_reviews.author: X. Wang

customer_reviews.title: overall good
customer_reviews.text: This semester I'm carrying around a large set of books and equipment on a daily and this bag really takes a beating running through campus. It fits massive text books my 15.6 laptop in it's sleeve, my heat sink, stationary supplies and everything i could possibly stuff into it. Unfortunately the front pocket it a little useless. stuff tends to get lost in the crevices and multiple layered flaps with no real depth to them. I wouldn't call it waterproof. I splashed water on the bag and it got into the bag through the handle holes at the top easily soaking my stuff inside.
customer_reviews.author: sandra entesari

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Through My Son's 7th Grade School Year
customer_reviews.text: My 7th grade boy did not destroy this backpack. We bought this backpack at the start of school in September 2018. My son carried all of his books, notebooks and Chromebook in this backpack without an issue. He dragged it up and down the concrete steps in front of our house. Zippers kept working. The pull out handle got a bit harder to put down, but is still functional. This backpack lasted much better than the one I purchased the year before. If my boy can't destroy it, chances are your kid won't either.
customer_reviews.author: Frogmother

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for school kids!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, as you can see the backpack is MUCH bigger then the previous one. I and my Daughter LOVE this rolly backpack. Shes in 7th grade and thus far it has held up very well. The previous backpack began falling apart and would no longer stand upright due to a "leg" falling off. We will see how it holds up for 8th grade!
customer_reviews.author: Suprdink

customer_reviews.title: BEST TEACHER BAG EVER!
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher, I drag everything I own back and forward to school daily. This bag will hold everything but the kitchen sink! It's lightweight, so the only thing weighing it down is my piles of ungraded papers and books. I recommend this bag to any teacher who is tired of breaking his or her back with the numerous bags you carry to and from work!
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: DOA, GOOD THING I DIDN'T TAKE IT ON A TRIP
customer_reviews.text: JUST BOUGHT THIS FOR FRIENDS FROM EUROPE. HAD IT MYSELF FOR 3 YEARS.TOLD THEM HOW GOOD IT WAS. HOW EMBARASSING WHEN IT CAME AND DIDN'T WORK. BUT, THIS NEW ONE THE HANDLE DOESN'T WORK, AND FEELS CHEAPLY MADE. USUAL CHINESE UNRELIABLE QUALITY. HOW TIRING IT'S GETTING SENDING ORDERS BACK FOR REFUND OR EXCHANGE.CAN WE EVER AGAIN BUY A SUITCASE NOT MADE IN CHINA AGAIN? WILL GET SAMSONITE NEXT TIME. THEY STAND BY THEIR PRODUCTS, HOWEVER, STILL MADE IN CHINA. VIETNAM PRODUCTS ARE ACTUALLY BETTER! LET'S HOPE! FOUND IT AT OUTLET CENTER FOR $30 LESS. SHOULD HAVE BOUGHT IT THERE!
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Still works and looks brand new!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I've ever made. I bought this for work because I often have to travel locally with a lot of materials. I've had this backpack for almost two years and it still looks brand new! It is very water-resistant and durable. I would love to say that I am gentle with it, but in all honesty, I drag it upstairs, walk through the rain, and shove a lot of stuff in there and it still looks and works like the day I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Sledd

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a full school year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is in high school. He is not rough with his things and uses it only in school with books and a small laptop. We got 5 months out of it before the wheels fell off.
customer_reviews.author: heatwinch

customer_reviews.title: I travel a lot and wanted a tough, medium-weight ...
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and wanted a tough, medium-weight, carry-on. But contrary to what's listed above in the product description it weighs 7 lbs EMPTY! I am 5'2" and carry a lot of stuff, so starting out at 7 lbs is a real deal-breaker. Also, the trim on the lining of the main compartment is already catching slightly in the zipper. That will surely wear-through over time. That U-shaped pocket in the front is shallow and angled forward; it doesn't make the contents secure. Am returning for different bag.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a much older version of the High Sierra backpack that lasted for 15 years. But this new one is definitely an upgrade. I use this for school and it is really saving me from having back issues from the weight if my books. It has a good size carrying capacity and is made out of heavy duty material. The wheels are much bigger than the previous model I had and can even go make it through dirt paths. I have no problems rolling it up curbs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W Chivabunditt

customer_reviews.title: reliable and rugged
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so far this has held up better than a Jansport bag that cost twice as much. My daughter uses it for heavy college textbooks and her laptop and it does great. It is constantly getting moved from home to car to class and back and is still going strong. She has had it for 7 months now with no issues. Her Jansport started failing with the handle right away and the only way to get it fixed was to mail it to Jansport to fix it. I figure if this one breaks, I can afford to easily replace it with another one without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Was a a nice bag, very poor customer service, be on a look out before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 or 3 times per week for collage, it performed very well till the wheel broke/got stuck late last year. Filed a claim along with photos and nothing. Still communicating with the manufacturer and as of today still nothing. Ripping off a freshman collage student is not cool, shame on them.
customer_reviews.author: chrismike2009

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, stores a a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdiness of this bag. I had a crimson red one that I loved, which is still in good shape, but the handle keeps sticking. I had it for 5 years. Thought I was getting the same red but this one is the chilli pepper red. A little to dark for me but I can seem to find the crimson red anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: RDC

customer_reviews.title: Few issues but overall not too bad.
customer_reviews.text: The handle keeps getting stuck half way up and we have to fight to get it all the way down or all the way up. After about months of use the wheels are not spinning very well. Would really love bigger wheels that lift the backpack higher off the ground and can put us with a little more ware and tare.
customer_reviews.author: Maya Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: A lot of space !!
customer_reviews.text: We like this backpack so much because of the following , 1- Easy to drive it 2- Plenty of space, currently with several books and notebooks. 3- Material is easy to clean The only thing is that the backpack by itself is a bit heavy so once you have stuff inside to bring it up or downstairs it gets heavier , other than that no complains at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this high Sierra power glide wheeled back pack. My back pack was starting to bother my shoulder taking it to work. This backpack was a great solution. It has large pockets, holds my MacBook, planner, books and whatever I need to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Aqualung

customer_reviews.title: / But I think it can be perfect for traveling with travel sized gear and going on ...
customer_reviews.text: Very multi use, high functioning backpack. I ended up not using it during my freshmen year of college because it was so bulky and I didn’t need that much stuff:/ But I think it can be perfect for traveling with travel sized gear and going on hiking/retreat trips. It has a compartment for small laptops (not big enough for a 15.6 inch sorry ) and it has a lot of pockets to hold a variety of products. Glad I had it for precaution
customer_reviews.author: ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice for a wheeled bag with backpack straps
customer_reviews.text: After an extensive search, I bought this to replace a faithful, old wheeled bag with backpack straps. The design has many practical features: zipped water bottle pocket (avoids an open mesh pocket where the bottle usually falls out); concealed backpack straps (avoids allowing the straps to get caught below the wheels); numerous easy access compartments, each with dual zippers; telescoping handle locks in the closed position (previous bag handle couldn't be used to lift the bag without extending); reflective trim makes it easy to see in the dark; lightweight when empty; ample storage; etc. It was perfect for international travel and a business class stewardess complimented the bag, which further validated my choice!
customer_reviews.author: picky shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it for my middle schooler who has alot of books to carry. Just from the the looks and feel of this bag it is already higher than what I expected. This bag is more for adults and I know my middle schooler well not ruin it as quickly as the kiddie book bags. I'll update if anything changes. Right now I'm happy I read the reviews on all the high Sierra bags and this one stood out more.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for nursing school!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack for nursing school. I have used it for 4 months now and I love it. The backpack is high quality and has lots of room ad different pockets. It holds a lot of heavy books and the wheels make it convenient. I live in Wisconsin so in these 4 months the backpack has already been through snow, mud, and all different terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Good bag - bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I needed a roller bag to carry my very large work laptop since its heavy and I have neck problems, using a traditional backpack wasn't working. This fits my 15", very thick laptop fine. The laptop pouch is in the middle pocket, rather than the backmost. The bag is much bigger than I was expecting, but not problematically so. It's an excellent carry-on size. It will not fit under the seat in front of you on an airplane. The back pocket is cavernous. Rolls well and handles comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Sapere Aude

customer_reviews.title: Great nursing school bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag got me through nursing school (ADN). It has great durability and can hold tons of books. As far as water resistance I can’t really say because i would commute everyday in my car. It did get wet a couple of times with rain from walking building to building and would dry up quick. I did not experience and breaks or tears at all. My two other classmates bough the same bag and loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Great in the rain but wheels not mean for daily shlepping on rugged terrain
customer_reviews.text: Served my purposes very well, but I put a lot of stress on the wheels and need replacements after less than a year. This is expensive and a nuisance. I really drag this bag all over the city streets in Manhattan, up and down curbs and subway stairs. High impact and a lot of friction, so it's probably not unreasonable. I love the water repellent material and great pockets. Just wish wheels were bigger, easier to replace, and a lot lighter.
customer_reviews.author: ajeweld1

customer_reviews.title: Price and ease
customer_reviews.text: The carry on high Sierra Powerglide was effortless to travel. No back pain after the long walk from the gate to the immigration lane. The compartments are well sectioned for laptop and batteries. Extra set of clothing, toiletries, shoes, and pair of slippers. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: AIDEEN PEREZ

customer_reviews.title: Backpack perfection
customer_reviews.text: This is the best backpack that I have ever had. I have been taking this around for over two years and it just works. the wheels and the handle are very sturdy. I have been swinging it up stairs and on and off of the train. my other cases would have crumbled by now. I would buy it again. the only minor issue (not problem) is that I like larger laptops so my 17" will not fit in the sleeve but it does fit in the section.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Not good for teenagers
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this backpack my 8th grader has so much stuff way to heavy to carry bought this for him and he loved it ... only been 4 months and it’s totally falling apart ... now I understand he’s 13 so not gonna last forever but only 4 months ???? ugh not happy !!!! I could of been happy with at least the full school year ..... won’t buy again don’t recommend for teens !!!
customer_reviews.author: Coral see

customer_reviews.title: I really do love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Been using this bag for about a year and a half. Purchased this after my Sharper Image rolling backpack broke. I really do love this bag. I'm an adjunct college professor and travel between several campuses everyday. I can easily fit several text books and incidentals inside. Overall the bag has held up well, but the handle has started to stick when trying to push it down. And it is definitely more of a rolling bag only, as it is quite a pain to quickly or easily switch back and forth between rolling and carrying. But I would highly recommend for anyone needing to carry several heavy/large books.
customer_reviews.author: FluteCat

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack for school over a year ago. I was a medical biller and coder student, I had huge books and tons of them. This bag held all of them AND my notebooks. My instructor would model my bag to other students and recommend they get one. I told them Amazon was the place. I love this bag.
customer_reviews.author: When in doubt shop

customer_reviews.title: Holds everything I need, and  then some.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful backpack. The wheels roll great, the backpack stays DRY when it rains, and it holds a ton. I'm trying to think of what I can't fit in here. This is what I typically keep in my backpack: Back section: Two large poly folders. Spanish-English dictionary Three textbooks Kipling 100 pens case Lily Pulitzer large agenda Sweater Kipling Kichirou lunch box Front section: Fat pocket spiral Book to read Change of clothes MacBook Pro Front pocket: Kipling Patti wristlet, with my phone in it Kipling Mila large case And I could still squeeze some stuff in there!
customer_reviews.author: Aquaria

customer_reviews.title: My office on the go
customer_reviews.text: As an adjunct instructor on a college campus, I need to be able to take my books, files, laptop, and other classroom essentials with me from room to room. This bag is sturdy, roomy, and versatile. And you wouldn't believe all the s%&$ I can fit into it! I love the big "all-terrain" type wheels and the upright design. I highly recommend this bag for anyone with a lot of stuff to tote.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Isham

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted one semester.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this bag- at first. I admit I was a heavy user, dragged it all over campus, full of heavy books and water bottles for one semester, then towards the end of the semester one of the wheels literally just fell off. Based on the other reviews, it looks like this bag works if you are a light user, but if you will be using it every day and filling it up, you might want to spring for a more expensive, more rugged bag. I learned my lesson and that's what I'll be doing in the future. It's cheaper than buying a bag over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: Jury still out on this one.
customer_reviews.text: Not as roomy as it would appear on the computer. Not even sure all myNursing books will fit. Side zip pockets says they are made to carry water bottle or whatever, but they appear short to point that I am afraid my tall water bottle would fall fall out too easily. I also think that they could have covered the zippers so they were not open to the elements. The zippers are listed as being “Not Waterproof” and some complain of water getting inside. Makes me worry about my laptop. I will update this review after a smemster or 2 of school.
customer_reviews.author: JayR101

customer_reviews.title: Good, but doesn't fit under plane seat.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, sturdy so far (one business trip). Just wish it could compact itself a bit better so that it could fit under the airplane seat. I'm 5 ft 1, and I always need something to support my feet on a plane ride, and thought (despite other people's reviews), that this would be perfect since I don't need leg room. As it turned out, I couldn't ever even fit it underneath the seat, so no foot rest for me! Will keep it now that I've used it, but will look for a more collapsible one next time. (the different compartments can't be compressed with compression ties like some other rolling backpacks have).
customer_reviews.author: fusiongal

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack with wheels to help me through school and it's the best! I used to carry a backpack with about 3 books (nursing school) and also hand carry my laptop, but that took a toll on my back and shoulders. I gave in and bought it. Going on 4 weeks since I've been using it, hauling 3 books, notebook, my lunch, clothes, and extra stuff and it has not let me down. Easy to maneuver, very spacious, handles all the weight well, and no more shoulder or back issues. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Robles

customer_reviews.title: Saves my back
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack in nursing school. It holds my 17.3” laptop and a 2” binder easily in the largest compartment. Plus, I can carry all my cords, pens, snacks, water bottle, and whatever else I need in the other spaces. The wheels are sturdy and rolls smoothly across the parking lot, sidewalk, and carpet. It has lasted 2 semesters so far, but I am in LOVE with it!
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Big but I miss small pockets
customer_reviews.text: So far it is surviving commuting by train, subway and foot to/from NYC. It was much larger than I expected. The configuration with the laptop in the center compartment is odd and tends to compress the back compartment if you have a large laptop. The front upper pocket (designed for a media player) is useless; the zipper configuration causes everything to fall out when you open it (when the bag is standing upright). Overall I like the bag but I really, really, really miss pockets. There are not enough to sort and store all the stuff you can haul with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: K. Weirich

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Quite on sidewalks etc.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS BACKPACK. When walking over the tiles at work there is barely any noise. It has enough room for all of my "stuff". I carry my kindle in the safe center compartment. I put snacks and drinks and other stuff in the larger compartment. I have to check my blood sugar every day and I keep all the materials needed in the large compartment too. I am very pleased with this product. I do have a less priced one that I have used for over a year and it makes a lot of noise being pulled over the tiles. I say this backpack is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: penchic

customer_reviews.title: Great over night back pack!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a small carry on that i could take 2 outfits, laptop, binder, toiletry bag, and use as a rolling bag, carry on, or back-pack. This is perfect! sturdy and well made. Even has room for my small purse, so i don’t have to carry it separately.
customer_reviews.author: L. McMullen

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in feb 2017.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one year with everyday use by 12 year old. Purchased in feb 2017. About a month or so ago, the handle started to give major grief . Sometimes stuck in the up and sometimes stuck in the down position. My son dragged this through the street of manhattan back and forth from school 5 days per week. He was very careful going up and down curbs- and up and down the stairs in school-NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Mary jane

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second High Sierra Powerglide Wheeled Laptop Backpack. They are very rugged, water repellant and the wheels make it perfect for carrying heavy loads. These are great backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: R. Aristy

customer_reviews.title: Durable, rolls well, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is so durable. Very lightweight even with wheels & handle. Where’s are sturdier than my samsonite. Only dislike is the electronic pouch at the top, zips at the bottom. Everything falls out when unzipped. Stupid!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Collins

customer_reviews.title: A very well made large/ tall backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made large backpack, with good quality wheels, and separate padded area for laptop. It has a very long handle, so pay careful attention to the specifications, it is made for a very tall person, I didn't notice that before purchasing. The handle can lock into two positions, and for me, one is too short, and the other too long. So, in the long position, it trails quite far and low behind me. I will likely use it as a rolling weekend bag because of size., and would recommend for its overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Did not make it through the school year
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rolling backpack after my son's other rolling backpack failed after the second week of the school year in September. We bought this one hoping that it woud get him through June 2016. One of the ball bearings in the wheels failed mid-April. All he did was take it to school 5 days a week. Not asking much, but thought this backpack could have done the job. Cannot recommend this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Y.

customer_reviews.title: The backpack has great shape and well thought out compartments
customer_reviews.text: The backpack has great shape and well thought out compartments, but it started ripping at the seam within the first month of use. The backpack was for my 9 yr old daughter for school use and she doesn't carry that much stuff inside. I purchased it in June and the backpack was not in use until this past September. I'm wondering and hoping High Sierra would offer an exchange for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheels still good. Handle still working
customer_reviews.text: Use every work day to haul my laptop and other items from car into office in all weather conditions for several years now. Even drag it up and down the cement stairs. It has also been my carry-on for several flights. No issues at all. Zippers all still working. Wheels still good. Handle still working. Just be careful not to have your fingers close to the handle extender when you push it in.
customer_reviews.author: IvyB5O5

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied, fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Wow , very satisfied ,fast delivery , even though its free and standard shipping,I salute the seller ( 5 star). The bag (red) beautiful, my daughter loves it,good quality, extension handle is firm, wheels rolls smoothly and quiet, big main compartment, lots of pockets to sort different things, tablet n laptop compartment, zipper is good quality, glides smoothly when opening and closing, no flaws I can see rt. now. So for me, this is the all around backpack thats good for high school and college students plus for traveling.Highly recommended and will buy again this product to this seller. :)
customer_reviews.author: imus boy

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a 17” laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in laptop compartment. The product description claims it will fit a 17” laptop but it is a full inch from being able to do so and actually close. A 17” laptop will only fit in the taller compartment meant for textbooks et al.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else, not up to par
customer_reviews.text: The handle is starting to come apart and I’ve only used it for picking up to carry upstairs or to put in my trunk. Undisclosed rails inside the bottom destroy your books and binders. Worst $70 I’ve spent in years.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Kube

customer_reviews.title: the zipper on the flap that holds the back straps ...
customer_reviews.text: the zipper on the flap that holds the back straps broke a few days into its use...my daughter uses it daily to take to school so it stands up to much heavy use...four months into daily middle-school usage, the top handle broke, the wheels lost their smoothness and she practically has to drag it across the ground...it's pretty much not good for any kinda use anymore...kinda sad, since it was a pretty good bag at first
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5th grader. They have to carry every book for every class since their school doesn't have lockers. This is the second wheeled bag I've purchased this year. The first was a Nike bag that quickly fell apart within two months. So far this bag is holding up with no tears and it glides smoothly. I wold definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST bag I have ever had. I have tried several but none of them can hold as much stuff as this one and the wheels roll very nice. I carry two laptops, my work and my personal laptops and their chargers and all my networking cables and tools and has room to spare, Most likely I will figure out more stuff to carry... this bag is assembled very well
customer_reviews.author: Randomatic99

customer_reviews.title: Durable, excellent design, great for my 17' laptop.
customer_reviews.text: This is everything I expected for and then some. It fits my 17' laptop in its padded case perfectly. It is also perfect for packing for a weekend getaway. Good, sturdy wheels also that have survived multiple international trips so far. The only downside: the top front compartment (designed for an mp3 player, etc) is less usefull with the zipper openning downwards than if the compartment was upside-down. It makes it difficult to store other items (like change, keys, etc) as they can easily drop off if you're not careful. But otherwise a great buy well worth it's price and an item I use now constantly when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: GrkG

customer_reviews.title: You will be happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I should give the product 5 stars but I remember when things were made to last. IT is just the right size to carry on and store in the over head bin. I always tell my wife that if she packs i t she carries it. Well she just can not get her stuff up the stairs so I use the backpack straps. Over all it is well made by today's standards and has plenty if compartments. It pulls well and I am 6-2. You will be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Mazeiko

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This backpack lasted 5 months with my middle schooler. The seams ripped and zippers broke. I was hoping it would've lasted at least the school year, but no!
customer_reviews.author: A.Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: This is working out pretty well for me
customer_reviews.text: This is working out pretty well for me. I had to figure out a way to transport watercolor supplies for plein air painting using wheels rather than as a regular backpack as my back can't take the weight or strain. The dimensions on this allowed me to use it for the En Plein Air Traveler easel. Everything fits in it with a little effort, but not bad. My complaint would be that the largest zipped area could unzip farther down the sides to be able to access that largest pocket better.
customer_reviews.author: PJs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent traveling capacity
customer_reviews.text: I used the Powerglide Wheeled Backpack on my European travel tour bc I need a backpack for the rigors of daily touring site without having something that I had to have hanging on me all the time. Many of the places I visited have lots of stairs and being able to wheel to the stairs and then pick up the bag was just a life-saver. It is possible to use as a back pack however, but I am not able to carry weight on my back and I had little to no trouble passing this bag through security at any of the historic sites or customs. Excellent traveling capacity.
customer_reviews.author: MJD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome back pack!
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy, well made, and easy to use! Great price for a wonderful bag! Has so much room and it easily stores on a plane. The wheels are amazing for a small bag and I love that you can cover up the backpack straps, or take them out to use!
customer_reviews.author: CaligirlfromOH

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I expected but good
customer_reviews.text: I had read the reviews and knew this bag was spacious, but I was surprised at just how big it is - just about the size of a standard rolling carry-on suitcase. A little more than I need for my daily commute, and I worry that it won't fit under the seat in front of me on an airplane (which I really want it to do), but I guess better too big than too small. It's well built and rolls well.
customer_reviews.author: SLPmom

customer_reviews.title: For my Wife
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made & very well designed backpack. Lots of room for your storage needs. We bought two of these for our upcoming trip back to the Philippines with our 6 month old in tow. Dimensions add up to be considered a "carry on" on Delta Flights. Very sturdy & well made. I actually was impressed with the overall design of the bag. It goes from a "backpack" to a small piece of luggage with wheels & tow handle. A zipper stores & conceals the arm straps & exposes a kick pad. So your able to tow it through airports. Overall I would definitely spend the money again for this very impressive, well made backpack/carry-on.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This bag is great. Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use while I was in dental hygiene school. This bag is great. Excellent quality. Roomy pockets, easy to organize, adequate padding for a lap top. I've had this for over 2 years and it is still in excellent condition. Nothing has broken, ripped or become loose on this. Great purchase! update Nov 2018 I've had the bag for 4 years now. I'm no longer in school but I use this bag when I travel and it has still held up well. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Should be just what's needed
customer_reviews.text: My grandson (going into 4th grade) looked it over and is very satisfied. Of course he hasn't used it yet, but I was becoming most concerned about developing bones and carrying an extremely heavy backpack every day. Wasn't sure he'd want a roller but when I asked I got an enthusiastic "YES!" It looks like it should hold up very well, and he likes the extra little pockets in front as well. I'll withhold 5 stars till he uses it a year. More color choices would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Marni

customer_reviews.title: Horrible bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag. For a trip to Europe. I didn't have a need to use it b4 my trip so the return window has closed. This bag is HORRIBLE. When using the wheels the bag tips to the side, spins upside down, it won't stay up right. It's been. A nightmare. Also, it's just to heavy of a bag. Please don't waste your money on this bag.
customer_reviews.author: CT2

customer_reviews.title: Holds my nursing books
customer_reviews.text: Nursing books are heavy! This keeps me organized without having to carry my books to class. Roomy pockets. 2 water bottle holders!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel bag for technology!
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of lugging around a heavy backpack filled with laptops, cables, etc, this is the PERFECT rolling pack for you! Yeah, sounds a little sales talk, but I kid you not. I travel for a yearly conference, and as a facilitator walking through large hotels that seem like miles long, this pack is idea for me; holds my 15' PC laptop and all accessories. And generally I'm having to carry far more items for the training I give. This is good for young adults, (Middle school/High school) but kids I think a bit much as they should have age appropriate. The slid handle is the perfect length, quality wheels. Save your back buy this bag!!
customer_reviews.author: Super Duty

customer_reviews.title: Sierra is long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: High Sierra is an awesome back pack. I have one that is 13 years old, still is great. The only issue is the wheels on the rolling backpack. This bag is 8 months old and the wheels are destroyed, the bag still looks and works perfect. Rolling around a college campus is hard on them. The first one that was primarily around high school the wheels lasted much longer and yes a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Z

customer_reviews.title: Has Actual Space!
customer_reviews.text: I am a full-time student and tutor, so I carry a lot of books, binders, notes, etc. I needed a bag that provided adequate space and this bag is it! It's spacious, sturdy, has many pockets, and looks great! I highly recommend this bag for school, work, and travelling. The "High Sierra" brand has not failed me, yet!
customer_reviews.author: MoonQueen

customer_reviews.title: High Sierra Powerglide Wheeled Backpack, Red ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack. I really use it for work as I am in the community seeing clients a lot. For an idea about the sie of the inside - it would hold 2 full size laptops in the front laptop pouch and probably 5-6 in the big pouch, and the very fron will hold a 6 inch subway and a bottle of water. It does not look that big but it will hold a ton. Plus there is 2 little pouched on the rear sides that can hold beanie and gloves. It also seems to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The bag is made well. However there is not much to it. There is very little in terms of organization in the larger compartments, just a big space. I have bought High Sierra products before and they were well thought out and very functional. This may be fine for someone that does not travel much, but this model will not work for me. I need more organization inside so I can quickly and easily locate and retrieve/put away cords, power supplies, files, etc. without digging in the bottom of each compartment. The headphone compartment does not work well with my over the ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: MovieMan

customer_reviews.title: great product so far
customer_reviews.text: i have only had this rolling backpack for 3 months but i am in love with it. I use it for school, but have also traveled with it and it is light, but spacious. It fits a book that is 1400 pages thick plus two thinner books a two inch folder and a 1 subject notebook plus my laptop and headsets. I thought that the pocket for the water would be a problem but it has worked out well for me. It also has the front pocket, which is super big as well. The bag is still like new and I use it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: peky

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but POOR durability.
customer_reviews.text: On the strength of the many positive reviews, I bought this for my son in December. It is now March and a wheel is already broken and non-repairable. Wouldn't you expect a bag of this size to have a metal axle for the wheels? I did too, but NO! Plastic and very unsubstantial at that. Now my son is carrying the bag which defeats the purpose of getting a wheeled bag! If you're considering this bag, and you need it to last more than a couple months, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Toughtoy4x4

customer_reviews.title: Other than that this is a great backpack for the price
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research/comparison on rolling backpacks before choosing this one. There are many of them out there but none had all the features I wanted- roomy interior, padded laptop compartment, upgraded wheels, fits in plane overhead bin and has luggage handle. The only negative feature is the small water bottle compartments - they will only hold an 8 oz bottle ! And these days the usual flip top size bottle is 20 oz. Other than that this is a great backpack for the price !
customer_reviews.author: Grace-27

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and Strong
customer_reviews.text: Am using this bag to transport several heavy hardcover music books. Am an entertainer, and have to walk to several locations within many large buildings. This bag is tough, spacious, and moves very easily. The wheels are larger than most bags like this, and promotes a smooth pulling transition from carpet, to wood, to sidewalk. Awesome design. Worth the reasonable cost. You will not be disappointed. BTW - I am NOT getting paid for my review.
customer_reviews.author: russellwr3

customer_reviews.title: Durable and very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 5th Grader whose backpack just can't seem to hold all of his school supplies and books and is very heavy for his little 10 year old body. At first I thought this Wheeled Book Bag was pretty big for him and was gonna return it but He likes it coz it holds all his extra binders and still have room. It's easy for him to roll it and it looks very well made just like his older High Sierra regular backpack. I hope this will last him for a long time. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Delia m

customer_reviews.title: Love the separate front pocket for my 13" Macbook Air
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this bag for school. My books are really heavy and I had a Swiss Gear bag that actually broke from the weight of my books-so I needed another plan. The High Sierra bag did LOOK big when I opened it-but I was so thankful after I put all my things in it I was thankful for the space. Love the separate front pocket for my 13" Macbook Air, and place for pens and supplies. A big selling pint too was that you can wheel it OR use it as a back pack. Also this would be a great travel bag on a plane. I'm so happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: I got this backpack last week and it is bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this backpack last week and it is bigger than I expected. I got this one instead of the Rev because it has more color selection than just black. I tested putting few of my sons 1 school binder 3 1/2 inch, 3 text books and five notebooks, these all fit to my surprise. Now we will see when school starts how it will last. This is my first buying a rolling backpack from Highsierra.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P

customer_reviews.title: Very highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Totally happy with this luggage. I used it for school. It was completely packed and it is very sturdy and well made. I also like the look of it. My son stole it when he moved out and I never got it back!
customer_reviews.author: Quiet3545

customer_reviews.title: BUY - won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I just received it and used it twice. I am impressed with it. Color - beautiful. Lots of pockets. Very roomy. Very well made and it feels and looks like it to! Zippers sturdy, easy pull. Wheels Glides beautifully. Color wonderful (Chilli) Looks very expensive but price great, affordable I expect it to last and last!
customer_reviews.author: PTG

product_meta.title: High Sierra Powerglide Wheeled Laptop Backpack
product_meta.description:
The High Sierra Powerglide Wheeled Laptop Backpack is a business inspired gamer laptop backpack. It is the perfect travel companion when you are hauling a lot of gear. A fully-padded laptop compartment and multi-pocket organizer is perfect for keeping your tech gear secure.

Enjoy a great travel adventure with this 17-in laptop backpack. It comes with a fully padded CushionZone laptop compartment that accommodates most 17-inch models. It is designed to endure shock while traveling. This backpack is equipped with a hideaway telescoping and locking handle that stores neatly under the zippered cover.

This gaming laptop backpack features a media pocket with headphone port so you can enjoy your favorite music or listen to your favorite audiobook anywhere you go. Multiple pockets including a zippered mesh pocket, pen pockets, lidded media pocket, and key fob hook are perfect for keeping all of your smaller items secure.

The Powerglide can be used as a roller bag or you can use the hidden backpack straps stored behind the zippered back panel for another carry option when the terrain gets rough. All-terrain style wheels are corner mounted for stability. A molded kick plate gives extra protection from abrasion.

Additional features like zippered side pockets and media pocket with headphone port make this pack the ultimate big hauler. The High Sierra Powerglide has all the features you need for work or play. Perfect for school, office, or any travel adventure.
feature_bullets: LARGE, MULTI-COMPARTMENT DESIGN: this student laptop backpack has a capacity of 2350 cubic inches with a large main compartment to fit all of your gear; multiple pockets allow you to keep all of your gear secure and organized

LAPTOP COMPARTMENT, MEDIA POCKET: this wheeled laptop backpack comes with a fully padded CushionZone laptop compartment that fits most 17-inch models; a media pocket with headphone port allows you to enjoy your favorite music or audiobook anywhere you go

MULTI-POCKET ORGANIZER COMPARTMENT: a boys laptop backpack or a gamer laptop backpack that includes an organizer compartment with zippered mesh pocket, pen pockets, lidded media pocket, and key fob hook; zippered side pockets provide more storage

DESIGNED FOR COMFORT and EASY MANEUVERABILITY: hidden padded backpack straps stowed behind a zippered back panel provides another carry option; corner mounted all-terrain style wheels and a molded kick plate offers stability and extra protection
RETRACTABLE HANDLE: this rolling backpack features a hideaway telescoping and locking handle that stores neatly under the zippered cover when not in use
